revised_title: Centenary Celebrations of the Societas Scientiarum Fennica
tldr: The article discusses the centenary celebrations of the Societas Scientiarum Fennica, a Finnish scientific society similar to the Royal Society or the Academy des Sciences. The celebrations included a series of lectures, historical review, and a gathering of distinguished scientists and representatives from various countries. The article also briefly mentions the 15th International Geographical Congress held in Amsterdam.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
